docs.abstract: Mark Bittman Op-Ed column offers several ideas for how to make food labels better, which would then encourage consumers to make better choices.
docs.lead_paragraph: A red, yellow or green “traffic light” displayed on a food label would encourage consumers to make better choices.
docs.snippet: A red, yellow or green “traffic light” displayed on a food label would encourage consumers to make better choices.

headline.seo: Stephanie Cutter Is a Messenger Who Does the Shooting for Obama
headline.print_headline: A Messenger Who Does the Shooting
headline.main: A Messenger Who Does the Shooting

docs.abstract: Stephanie Cutter, a deputy campaign manager for the Obama re-election effort, has emerged as Pres Obama’s one-woman attack squad, and in the process has become a polarizing face of a campaign that until recently had been dominated by middle-aged white men.
docs.lead_paragraph: Stephanie Cutter has emerged as President Obama’s one-woman attack squad, and in the process has become a polarizing face of a campaign that until recently had been dominated by middle-aged white men.
docs.snippet: Stephanie Cutter has emerged as President Obama’s one-woman attack squad, and in the process has become a polarizing face of a campaign that until recently had been dominated by middle-aged white men.

headline.seo: Cook’s Illustrated’s Christopher Kimball Believes Cooking Is Ultraserious Business
headline.print_headline: ’Cooking isn’t creative and it isn’t easy’
headline.main: ‘Cooking Isn’t Creative, and It Isn’t Easy’

docs.abstract: Alex Halberstadt article explores the success of Cook's Illustrated; cooking manual was created by Christopher Kimball, who has edited and published it for 19 years.
docs.lead_paragraph: Christopher Kimball refuses to celebrate anything smacking of joie de vivre. Therein lies his success.
docs.snippet: Christopher Kimball refuses to celebrate anything smacking of joie de vivre. Therein lies his success.

headline.seo: Women on TV Step Off the Scale
headline.print_headline: Female Stars Step Off The Scale
headline.main: Female Stars Step Off the Scale

docs.abstract: Women in entertainment are obsessing less about their weight and setting their own standards of beauty; self-acceptance has become a new form of defiance on television, especially among a new breed of younger female comedians who are looking for a fresh twist in a landscape where profanity, obscenity and intolerance have little comic shock value left.
docs.lead_paragraph: Women in entertainment are obsessing less about their weight and setting their own standards of beauty.
docs.snippet: Women in entertainment are obsessing less about their weight and setting their own standards of beauty.

headline.seo: Soda Industry Sues to Stop Bloomberg’s Sales Limits
headline.print_headline: Soda Industry Sues to Stop A Sales Ban On Big Drinks
headline.main: Soda Industry Sues to Stop a Sales Ban on Big Drinks

docs.abstract: American Beverage Association, joined by several New York restaurant and business groups, files lawsuit that aims to overturn restrictions approved by the Board of Health on sales of large sugary drinks at many dining locations in the New York City; suit contends that board did not have the authority to ratify the rules, scheduled to take effect in March, unilaterally.
docs.lead_paragraph: The lawsuit, filed in State Supreme Court in Manhattan, contends that the New York City Board of Health did not have the authority to pass the rules.
docs.snippet: The lawsuit, filed in State Supreme Court in Manhattan, contends that the New York City Board of Health did not have the authority to pass the rules.

headline.print_headline: When Children Reject a Healthy Lunch
headline.main: When Children Reject a Healthy Lunch

docs.lead_paragraph: Readers react to a front-page article about children’s resistance to federally mandated school lunches.
docs.snippet: Readers react to a front-page article about children’s resistance to federally mandated school lunches.

headline.main: A Cardiologist Makes the Case For Taxing Soda

docs.abstract: Jeff Ritterman, a cardiologist and member of the Richmond, California, City Council, is spearheading the effort to institute a penny-per-ounce soda tax in Richmond, California. Here's why.
docs.snippet: Jeff Ritterman, a cardiologist and member of the Richmond, California, City Council, is spearheading the effort to institute a penny-per-ounce soda tax in Richmond, California. Here's why.

headline.print_headline: Pepsi and Coke to Post Calories of Drinks Sold in Vending Machines
headline.main: Pepsi and Coke to Post Calories of Drinks Sold in Vending Machines

docs.abstract: Pepsico and Coca-Cola are retooling their vending machines to let consumers know the number of calories in the soft drinks available to buy; program will first appear in Chicago and San Antonio in early 2013 and later nationwide.
docs.lead_paragraph: The two big soda companies, often criticized for producing drinks that are too sugary, will post the figures first in San Antonio and Chicago and later nationwide.
docs.snippet: The two big soda companies, often criticized for producing drinks that are too sugary, will post the figures first in San Antonio and Chicago and later nationwide.
